intro: Licania tambopatensis, commonly known as the Tambopata licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
